Welcome people of the inter-webs! Do you rule a galaxy? Have pesky rebels that try to stop you from flexing your muscles? Than does Major Leauge Industries Domination Department have the thing for you!! We have a catalog full of weapons designed to strike fear into the hearts of enemies! And all of them are scientifically legit!

Meet our weapons!

Turbo Laser

A gigantic cannon capable of destroying some planets! A really big laser. The death star. What am I doing.

Rail Gun "Thor"

Launches a very heavy object at a planet at extremely high speeds. Imagine a super dense pole about the height of the Eiffel Tower. Now imagine that impacting a planet at Mach 40. Yeah, a lot of destruction.

 

 

More soon! Add suggestions!

There seems to be an absence of science in this thread. What is its purpose?
War mongering! War mongering, i tell ya!
I think the op is trying to ask which of those weapons are better, scientifically.

I'm gonna go with the "taking suggestions for superweapons" angle. <--- Evil Overlord stare

A recent development of mine, and a personal favorite, is the Matter Dis......wait......forgot--I gotta use the big font.

The Matter Disruptor Beam

How it works (yes, actual science here): as opposed to a disintegrator, which just zaps matter completely out of existence (and probably violates the laws of thermodynamics wholesale!), the Disruptor Beam neutralizes the fundamental forces that hold atomic nuclei together. Instead of disintegrating, the target is shattered at the subatomic level. The end result is functionally identical to nuclear fission: any matter contacted by the Matter Disruptor will produce a thermonuclear-scale detonation.

The weapon is equally effective against all targets, armored or not--the beam will detonate armor as easily as any other matter, then continue through the hole and detonate whatever's inside. When used against planets, the Disruptor will interact with the atmosphere as well as the surface! Imagine the look of terror on your enemies' faces as the very air itself seems to catch fire.......

Pre-order now and get a free sample of biological weapons agents!

Actually, the real problem with the Sunshade is, there's no practical way to keep it in position between the planet and its Sun. The only stable point where that's possible without a HUGE amount of delta-V would be the LaGrange point between the two--but a Sunshade there would have to be nearly the size of the star to block its light from reaching the planet.

Well, well......it would seem I'm out of the closet. So be it then.

If you believe the previous message by "Wedge" was sent by "heroes" (hmph!) you are mistaken. It was sent by me. The Baroness, of Cobra Command. Wedge's irresponsible avenues in weapons development represent a threat to us, and it has become necessary to......sidetrack him. Hacking his computer was the first step. (seriously, who uses the password "password" any more???)

While we appreciate your dedication, you fail to realize the true scale of what you're attempting. A sunshade positioned to block the sun cannot possibly be positioned in any kind of reasonable Earth orbit; the only possible orbit would be one year in duration and coplanar with the Earth and Sun. This coincides with the L1 LaGrange point, which is dynamically unstable. An object at this location would require constant application of delta-V (and therefore constant resupply) to stay in position, and would also have to be approximately half the Sun's radius in size--both of which are simply not feasible.

Take my advice, and stay out of our way. It is Cobra who shall rule the world......not any of you.
